definition: to wind around/to wrap round/to coil/tangle/to involve/to bother/to annoy
"silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]
to be in a tangle/to nag
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental

sentences.english: The insect found itself entangled in an inextricable net.
sentences.chinese: 昆虫发现自己被缠在一个逃脱不掉的罗网中。

sentences.english: Will you wind this wool for me?
sentences.chinese: 请你帮我将这些毛线缠起来好吗？

sentences.english: Fortunately my friend had a sweater, and I tied it around my waist.
sentences.chinese: 幸运的是我朋友有一件厚运动衫，我把它缠在了腰上。

sentences.english: Manually reeve 6 wraps of the 1 inch manila rope onto the drawworks drum.
sentences.chinese: 把一寸的棕绳在绞车辊筒上缠六圈。

sentences.english: The transparent bag of rope wooding is designed, ocular and durable.
sentences.chinese: 透明袋缠绳设计，直观耐用。

sentences.english: He pointed at her foot, which was wrapped in thick white bandages.
sentences.chinese: 他指着她缠着厚厚白绷带的那只脚。

sentences.english: Josh looks up and sees that the contracting tentacles are bringing him much closer to the pulpy mouth.
sentences.chinese: 杰克往上看见缠着他的触手正在把他送近柔软的嘴巴。

sentences.english: The little girl kept at her father to take her to the cinema.
sentences.chinese: 那个小女孩缠着她父亲带她去电影院。

sentences.english: No matter how many miles have tried tied together, not be considered as leave.
sentences.chinese: 不管多少里路也试过缠在一起，未算别离。

sentences.english: It goes far beyond the guy who always wants to mooch lunch off of me, too.
sentences.chinese: 这样会使经常缠着我蹭饭吃的人产生非分之想。

sentences.english: The boy importuned the teacher to raise his mark.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩缠着老师给他加分。

sentences.english: Opossum looked at the bright shiny ribbon wrapped around his tail.
sentences.chinese: 负鼠看着明亮的光泽围绕他的尾巴缠剪彩。

sentences.english: She held his wrist and wrapped the soft hand - kerchief round it.
sentences.chinese: 腕用柔软的手帕把它缠起来。

sentences.english: She prepared to undo the band of cloth around his arm which had served as tourniquet.
sentences.chinese: 她准备解开缠在他胳臂上止血的布带。

sentences.english: His fishing-line got fouled up in the weeds.
sentences.chinese: 他的钓丝和杂草缠在一起了。

sentences.english: He had ingeniously strapped a number of packages to his legs containing contraband items.
sentences.chinese: 他很聪明，脚上缠着几盒含有违禁物品的东西。

definition: to twist (strands into a thread)/to entangle/to wring/to hang (by the neck)/to turn/to wind/classifier for skeins of yarn
to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap
